Superb 3D animation illustrates the concept of ‘ratio of fire’ in modern warfare.

results.title: The Quiet family
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Mari Kim
results.brief_description: This 2D tale of horror has an unexpected twist to it - all is not what it seems! An Addams type of family deals with the consequences of having their little darling make friends with the rest of the world. Mainly b&w with splashes of colour. Hand-drawn animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Mari Kim
results.description: This 2D tale of horror has an unexpected twist to it - all is not what it seems! An Addams type of family deals with the consequences of having their little darling make friends with the rest of the world. Mainly b&w with splashes of colour. Hand-drawn animation.

results.title: Looking for Joe
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Andrew Buchanan
results.brief_description: 2D and 3D combine in this tribute to film noir. Time and perspective are toyed with as the story weaves between character viewpoints - the viewer’s sense of disorientation is heightened by the striking visual style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Andrew Buchanan
results.description: 2D and 3D combine in this tribute to film noir. Time and perspective are toyed with as the story weaves between character viewpoints - the viewer’s sense of disorientation is heightened by the striking visual style.
description_for_label: 2D and 3D combine in this tribute to film noir. Time and perspective are toyed with as the story weaves between character viewpoints - the viewer’s sense of disorientation is heightened by the striking visual style.

results.title: The Kite
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Ami Chew
results.brief_description: A fascinating animated work which uses string and buttons and other materials to create a sympathetic and likable character whose dream is to free a kite caught up in a tree on the top of a hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Ami Chew

results.title: Jettison
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Adrian Rose
results.brief_description: Abstract shapes, distorted figures jettison on and off the screen metamorphosing to the rhythmic beat of “The Deadly art of knowledge” by Chris MacKellar. A vibrant celebration of the potential of animated forms to constantly move, change and surprise. Obtained an Honourable Mention in the Australian Panorama section of Australian International Animation Festival
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Adrian Rose
results.description: Abstract shapes, distorted figures jettison on and off the screen metamorphosing to the rhythmic beat of “The Deadly art of knowledge” by Chris MacKellar. A vibrant celebration of the potential of animated forms to constantly move, change and surprise. Obtained an Honourable Mention in the Australian Panorama section of Australian International Animation Festival
